FuncDef: The ssh user service-type command configures a service type for an SSH user. The ssh user service-type command configures a service type for an SSH user. By default, the service type of the SSH user is not configured.

ParaDef.Info:
Indicates the name of an SSH user.
The name is a string of 1 to 253 characters.

Indicates that SFTP, STelnet, SCP, or SNETCONF can be used as the service mode.
-

ExtraInfo: If the user does not exist, a new SSH user with the specified user-name is created and the configured service type is adopted for the user.
